duties_responsibilities.duty: Review menus and customer orders, properly measures and portions all food items.
Plan menus and estimate required food quantities, labor, and overhead costs.
Lead the work of kitchen assistants in preparing, cooking, and storing food, as well as in maintaining kitchen and storage facilities in sanitary condition.
Utilize kitchen equipment to prepare food items and ensure proper food temperatures are maintained.
Ensure freshness and quality of all menu items and packages all products to proper specifications.
Perform opening, closing, and side work duties as instructed and according to proper guidelines.
Keep workstation, coolers, and equipment clean, organized, sanitized, and sufficiently stocked.
Follow and uphold all health codes and sanitation regulations.
Use waste control guidelines and record all waste on spoilage sheet.
Complete end of day inventory and other opening/closing duties in accordance with company checklists and procedures.

education_certification.credential: 3 to 4 years cooking experience in upscale establishments required.
Participation in a culinary program preferred.
Ability to read and comprehend prep sheets and recipes.
Basic math skills; ability to understand, calculate and follow recipe measurements and proportions.
Manual dexterity sufficient for food preparation and cooking.
Physical ability to handle or operate dangerous kitchen equipment.
Standing and walking for entire shift length.
Frequently required to reach, twist, bend, and squat.
Kitchen environment awareness and ability to work in hot and damp conditions.
